Masih Ada Korupsi di Daerah WTP, Afiliasi Politik Anggota BPK Jadi Sorotan
07 Nov 2019, 08:59 by Muhammad Fida Ul Haq
Jakarta - Badan Pemeriksa Keuangan (BPK) memberikan predikat untuk laporan keuangan setiap daerah, tapi tetap saja banyak kepala daerah yang terjerat kasus korupsi. Pegiat antikorupsi dari Universitas Andalas Feri Amsari menghubungkan fenomena tersebut dengan afiliasi anggota BPK dengan partai politik.
"Selama diisi oleh politisi dan tidak menempatkan figur-figur profesional tapi malah orang-orang mantan anggota DPR, politik. Sehingga audit yang disampaikan itu jauh dari nilai profesionalitas. Makanya kita bisa melihat kontradiksinya, ini WTP kok terjadi korupsi. Ada WTP kok kemudian ada OTT dan segala macam," kata Feri kepada detikcom, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Feri menuturkan jika tidak diseleksi secara objektif, WTP dinilai tidak mencerminkan minimnya kasus korupsi. Dia mengatakan yang salah bukan penilaian wajar tanpa pengecualian (WTP) namun yang paling penting adalah penilainya.
"Makanya yang perlu diperbaiki itu adalah yang memberikan penilainya, bukan nilainya yang dilihat. Kalau bagus, bebas dari kepentingan politik, dan segala macamnya, sudah terjamin kemandiriannya," jelasnya.

There is Still Corruption in the WTP Area, Political Affiliations of BPK Members Become Highlights
Nov 7 2019, 08:59 by Muhammad Fida Ul Haq
Jakarta - The Supreme Audit Agency (BPK) gives a predicate for financial reports in each region, but still many regional heads are caught in a corruption case. Anti-corruption activists from Andalas University Feri Amsari connect the phenomenon with the affiliation of BPK members with political parties.
"As long as it is filled with politicians and does not place professional figures but instead are former members of the DPR, politics. So the audit submitted is far from professionalism. So we can see the contradictions, this is the PAP corruption. There is PAP why then there is OTT and all kinds, "Feri said to AFP on Wednesday (11/06/2019).
Feri said if not objectively selected, PAPs were considered not to reflect the lack of corruption cases. He said what was wrong was not an unqualified valuation (WTP) but the most important thing was the evaluation.
"Therefore, what needs to be improved is the one that gives the assessment, not the value seen. If it is good, free from political interests, and all kinds, independence is guaranteed," he explained.
